1372543532020469762.text:
What actions do I need to take now? 

Other than filing your 2021 taxes to ensure the IRS has your up to date family information, no action is needed at this time. Keep an eye out for more information later this year on how the monthly delivery will work.

1372543530778890244.text:
How long will these payments be made for? 

This credit is currently only for 2021, but I’m fighting to make them permanent!

1372543529499627520.text:
Who qualifies for this credit? 

Individuals who make up to $75,000 a year or joint filers making up to $150,000 a year qualify for the tax credit. From there, the funds will be reduced by 50 dollars for every additional one thousand dollars of gross income.

1372543528102936579.text:
How will this credit be delivered? 

For the first time, a portion of the credit will be delivered monthly, beginning in the second half of this year. Families will receive the rest when filing 2021 taxes in 2022.

1372543526853038080.text:
How much will qualifying families receive? 

Families with children under 6 will receive an increased credit, totaling $3,600 per child. Families with children ages 6-17 will receive a total credit of $3K per child.   Family income can no longer be too low to receive the credit.

1371862500015243271.text: For more information on stimulus checks visit https://t.co/wMN2gjEjIe

1371862498840829953.text:
What if I don’t usually file taxes?

The IRS is urging people who don’t normally file a tax return to look into their filing options. Visit https://t.co/vlh4eSlfQI for more information about options available.

1371862497851023371.text:
What if the IRS does not have my information?

You can input your direct deposit information using the IRS’s “Get My Payment” tool, see link below!
https://t.co/Pphn4NVtnk

1371862496819171336.text:
How will I get my payment?

Payments will be directly deposited into bank accounts, or come in the mail as a paper check or debit card. Visit the IRS’s "Get My Payment” tool to find out how the IRS will be delivering your payment.

1371862495867109390.text:
What do I need to do to claim my payment?

Most eligible people will get the 3rd stimulus check automatically & won’t need to take more action. The IRS will use available information from your most recent tax return to determine eligibility & which bank account to send it to.

1371862494600327174.text:
Do qualifying dependents also receive a check? What about adult dependents?

Yes and yes! Qualifying families receive $1,400 for each dependent. That includes adult dependents over the age of 17 too! So if you’re a single mother with 2 dependents, you will receive $4,200!

1371862492910080009.text:
Will I get a stimulus check if I make over 75K?

Maybe. Individuals making under $80,000 and married filers making under $160,000 will receive a reduced payment. Households over those incomes will not receive a payment.

1371862491882532864.text:
Who qualifies for a stimulus check, and how much would I get?

If you’re a single filer and earn less than $75,0000 annually you qualify. If you’re married & filing jointly and earn less than $150,000 you qualify! Qualifying individuals will receive $1,400

1359986337621938177.text: The provision will also finally expand the EITC to include seniors! It's simply not right that you can owe more taxes, simply because you turned 65 and are getting closer to retirement. We're fixing that!

1359960274074279941.text: This expansion also raises thresholds for the Child Tax Credit to include middle class families. 1359960272681783307.text: BIG NEWS: The expansion of the Child Tax Credit will cut childhood poverty in HALF! The #AmericanRescuePlan will increase the tax credit to $3600 for a child under 6 & $3000 for all other children. This is needed now more than ever due to the pandemic.
